titles.title: To require the prompt review by the Secretary of the Interior of the longstanding petitions for Federal recognition of certain Indian tribes, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 109-694.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 419.

bill.summary: 9/28/2006--Reported to House without amendment. Requires the prompt review by the Secretary of the Interior of the long-standing petitions of eligible Indian tribes for federal recognition. Sets forth a process for potentially eligible tribes to opt into expedited procedures so they can be considered eligible for recognition.Authorizes an eligible tribe to seek the judicial review of a final determination refusing federal recognition in the appropriate United States district court.
